intro: Salsola brevifolia, commonly known as dwarf Russian thistle, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia and the Mediterranean. It is a shrub-like species with small, fleshy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is adapted to harsh environments, featuring a deep root system and succulent tissues to conserve water. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in poor, sandy conditions. Salsola brevifolia is also known for its ability to spread rapidly, making it a common weed in agricultural areas.
